newsitem.title: USA: Duke Power says Q3 affected by weather.
newsitem.headline: Duke Power says Q3 affected by weather.

text.p: Duke Power Co. said on Tuesday its drop in earnings for the 1996 third quarter stemmed from mild weather and unexpected costs related to Hurricane Fran in September.
The utility company said it paid $13.2 million to cleanup after Hurricane Fran.

"Milder weather for the quarter, especially in August, led to lower overall sales," said Richard Osborne, chief financial officer. "That, plus costs associated with Hurricane Fran and a decline in income at Duke's subsidiary companies, were key drivers for the quarter."
Duke Power said total retail sales were down 1.2 percent for the quarter. Residential sales were down 1.7 percent, but general service or commercial sales were up 2.8 percent.
"The weather had the most impact on residential sales," Osborne said. "However, we were pleased to see that commercial and other industrial sales continue to grow."
Industrial sales overall were up slightly at 0.9 percent. The only slippage was in textile sales, down 2.8 percent.
During the quarter, Duke Power experienced the force of Hurricane Fran throughout its service territory, affecting power to almost 400,000 customers early in September.
